title: [FLINK-31664][table] Add ARRAY_INTERSECT function
body:
- What is the purpose of the change
This is an implementation of ARRAY_INTERSECT

- Brief change log
ARRAY_INTERSECT for Table API and SQL
    
```
Returns an array of the elements in the intersection of array1 and array2, without duplicates.

Syntax:
array_intersect(array1, array2)

Arguments:
array: An ARRAY to be handled.

Returns:
An ARRAY. If any of the array is null, the function will return null.
Examples:

> SELECT array_intersect(array(1, 2, 3), array(1, 3, 5));
 [1,3]

```


See also
spark https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/sql/index.html#array_intersect
presto https://prestodb.io/docs/current/functions/array.html

- Verifying this change
This change added tests in CollectionFunctionsITCase.

Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): ( no)

## What is the purpose of the change
To make Hive connector not use flink-table-planner dependency with provided scope any more.


## Brief change log
- [cb14f1](https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22620/commits/cb14f15a4f22991e0cfbd82ec0c3688a015a073f) creates `PlannerCalciteQueryOperation` in `flink-table-calcite-bridge` to avoid hive connector using `PlannerQueryOperation` located in `flink-table-planner`.
- [79cae8](https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22620/commits/79cae8b955c0ff4efffd5c8ee01b9f691e1eda87) copies some code from `OperationConvterUtils` to `TableSchemaUtils` to avoid hive connector using `OperationConvterUtils` located in `flink-table-planner`.
- [6f55d0](https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22620/commits/6f55d01205b375c37425866bf6607ecfc60c80f5) removes usage org.apache.flink.table.planner.functions.* located in `flink-table-planner
- [3756ae](https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22620/commits/3756ae3a1a592bc71c0adb923bace9622d06c227) copies HintPredicate,NodeTypeHintPredicate, LogicalDistribution,LogicalScriptTransform, ExpressionBuilder from `flink-table-planner` to hive connector
- [7d6d6f](https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22620/commits/7d6d6ff19ea573471f8128f3fba8f777cf7265b2) allows to HiveParser to parse some special command to avoid always delegating these commands to default flink parser.
- [27db16](https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22620/commits/27db1693a5c099eb9cf476efab3aab88b9185faa) removed the logic that always fall back to default flink parser and change the scope of flink-table-planner dependency  from provided to test. We still need flink-table-planner dependency in test since the tests for Hive dialect will use it.


## Verifying this change
This change is already covered by existing tests.

title: [FLINK-32152][tests] Consolidate mocking library usage
body:
Migrates most powermock usages to mockito. We mock a few static things with powermock that couldn't be migrated easily.
The goal is to reduce powermock usages to a minimum, and limit the powermock dependency to flink-core/runtime in a follow-up.

Note: This PR is not touching mocks that are being removed in #22616.

## What is the purpose of the change

Using strongly increasing nanosecond timestamp and DeleteColumn type to fix data accidental deletion and non deletion issues when sink upsert data to hbase.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-32139

## Brief change log

  - Add  a class HBaseTimestampGenerator which generates strongly increasing timestamp in nanoseconds to set to hbase mutation.
  - HBaseSerde createPutMutation and createDeleteMutation use muation with timestamp.
  - Use delete.addColumns instead of delete.addColumn, the first hbase client api use [DeleteColumn key type](https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/c05ee564d3026688bcfdc456071059c7c8409694/hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/Delete.java#L322) and the second use [Delete key type](https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/c05ee564d3026688bcfdc456071059c7c8409694/hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/Delete.java#L380).


## Verifying this change
  - Added test that validates that HBaseTimestampGenerator generates strongly increasing timestamp.
  - Online test described in [#32139](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-32139)

title: [FLINK-32122] Update the Azure Blob Storage document to assist in configuring the MSI provider with a shaded class name
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Many users have reported on the mailing list that they are unable to configure the ABFS filesystem as a checkpoint directory. This is often due to ClassNotFoundException errors for Hadoop classes that are configured in the configuration value. For instance, when using MsiTokenProvider for ABFS storage in Flink, it should be configured with the shaded class name. title: [FLINK-32053][table-planner] Introduce StateMetadata to ExecNode to support configure operator-level state TTL via CompiledPlan
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

This PR is a subtask of FLIP-292 to enable operator-level state TTL configuration via `CompiledPlan`.


## Brief change log

Introduce `StateMetadata` to all `ExecNode`s that translate to stateful operators, and changes the way how `#translateToPlanInternal` get the state retention time. 

The affected `ExecNode` list
```
    StreamExecChangelogNormalize
    StreamExecDeduplicate
    StreamExecGlobalGroupAggregate
    StreamExecGroupAggregate
    StreamExecIncrementalGroupAggregate
    StreamExecJoin
    StreamExecLimit
    StreamExecLookupJoin
    StreamExecRank
    StreamExecSink
    StreamExecSortLimit
```


## Verifying this change
Since we have upgraded some `ExecNode`s to version 2, we have to test the following 3 parts:
1. The plan serialized using version 1 can be deserialized using the current version. This can be verified by `TransformationsTest#testUidFlink1_15`
2. The plan with the current version SerDe work as expected. This can be verified by all tests under package `org.apache.flink.table.planner.plan.nodes.exec.stream`
3. The way by modifying the JSON content to change state TTL works as expected. This can be verified by ITCase `ConfigureOperatorLevelStateTtlJsonITCase`


## Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

  - The serializers: no

  - The S3 file system connector: no

body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Flink does not really do a good job at distributing the tasks uniformly across the taskmanagers of the cluster.
The reason is that there is no strategy for spreading out the tasks, they are simply assigned to the next available slots. This PR improves this by simply sorting the available slots in a way that slots from different TMs are interleaving as evenly as possible.

This works for both the the Default and Adaptive scheduler. The new behaviour can be turned on and off by a new config.

## Verifying this change

New unit tests have been added.

## Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

  - Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): no
  - The public API, i.e., is any changed class annotated with `@Public(Evolving)`: no
  - The serializers: no
  - The runtime per-record code paths (performance sensitive): no
  - Anything that affects deployment or recovery: JobManager (and its components), Checkpointing, Kubernetes/Yarn, ZooKeeper: yes
  - The S3 file system connector: no

## Documentation

  - Does this pull request introduce a new feature? yes
  - If yes, how is the feature documented? not documented

title: [FLINK-32071] Implement the snapshot manager for merged checkpoint files in TM
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

As the first part of FLIP-306, which aims to provide an unified file merging mechanism for checkpoint files, this ticket/PR implements the basic file manager for merged files, providing file system directory layout and its initialization. It also provides the implementation of physical and logical files and the reference counting relationship between them.

## Brief change log

- Add definition of FileMergingSnapshotManager and a base implementation.
- Add definition of PhysicalFile and LogicalFile.

**(The sections below can be removed for hotfixes of typos)**
-->

## What is the purpose of the change
This is an implementation of ARRAY_EXCEPT


## Brief change log
ARRAY_EXCEPT for Table API and SQL
```
Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[1,2,2], array[2,3,4]);
[1]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[1,2,2], array[1]);
[2]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[1,2,2], array[42]);
[1, 2]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[1,2,2], cast(null as array<int>));
[1, 2]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[1,2,2], array[null,2]);
[1]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(cast(null as array<int>), array[1,2,3]);
<NULL>

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[null,null,1], array[42]);
[NULL, 1]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[null,null,1], array[null, 42]);
[1]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[(TRUE, DATE '2022-04-20'), (TRUE, DATE '1990-10-14'), null], array[(TRUE, DATE '1990-10-14')]);
[(TRUE, 2022-04-20), NULL]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[(TRUE, DATE '2022-04-20'), (TRUE, DATE '1990-10-14'), null], cast(null as array<row<col1 boolean, col2 date>>));
[(TRUE, 2022-04-20), (TRUE, 1990-10-14), NULL]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[array[1,null,3], array[0], array[1]], array[array[0]]);
[[1, NULL, 3], [1]]

Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[map[1, 'a', 2, 'b'], map[3, 'c', 4, 'd']], array[map[3, 'c', 4, 'd']]);
[{1=a, 2=b}]

// Error message with the CommonArrayInputStrategy. Without the CommonArrayInputStrategy the output is [1]
Flink SQL> SELECT array_except(array[1], array['this is a string']);
[ERROR] Could not execute SQL statement. Reason:
org.apache.flink.table.api.ValidationException: Could not find a common type for arguments: [ARRAY<INT NOT NULL> NOT NULL, ARRAY<CHAR(16) NOT NULL> NOT NULL]
```
See also https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/sql/index.html#array_except

## Verifying this change
- This change added tests in CollectionFunctionsITCase.

title: [FLINK-31880][tests] Fixes unit test so it will pass regardless of ti…
body:
Fixes unit test so it will pass regardless of time zone it is run in. Also use a better testing date.

I submitted this before, I'm resubmitting with issues fixed. This should follow commit and PR style guides.

This is a low priority issue, as the Flink projects only needs unit tests to pass in the CI system, not in other environments in other time zones, but it's helpful to some developers to have this pass, this is very low risk, and this also uses a better test value. The previous code uses `new Date(562423)` which is 9 minutes after the epoch in UTC, and in UTC-5 time zone it's before the epoch of 1970-01-01, and that's a poor test value.

title: [FLINK-28744][table] Upgrade Calcite to 1.31.0
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

The PR is to upgrade Calcite dependency to 1.31.0
There are several major changes done in Calcite 1.31.0  leading to plan changes (I broke down these plan changes in separate commit with Calcite JIRA issue in git comment as a reason)

About commits
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/ffc3c611e580ae75e1b3f437e0595a676435c283 Remove all Calcite classes from Flink code which could be removed with upgrade to 1.31.0
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/b2ec46d1a096768b100084e24ea2d4810dd8a5ba Sync Calcite classes with https://github.com/apache/calcite/releases/tag/calcite-1.31.0
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/abed1c9a7cc221d8b87a5a9e2fd7ea71c80a0b6e Update pom and NOTICE files. Here I removed exclusion of api.guardian from Calcite since now it's updated till the latest version 1.1.2 (same as junit-jupiter).
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/31cef43dfcb08fdeaea5d66fadf9fe38be9603f0 Applies changes to Flink classes required for the upgrade
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/02ab424b6bb4a1fd1b2e3ca0c459ef7e4808438c Applies changes to plans after [CALCITE-4861](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-4861) (**Optimization of chained CAST calls can lead to unexpected behavior**)
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/0de5f2c74c1326f8654054db7340bb04fee15152 With this Calcite fix [CALCITE-5117](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-5117) (**Optimize the EXISTS sub-query by Metadata RowCount**) the query in **testWithFilterJoinCorrelate** test stopped failing
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/98ca3109955a821e1ca10001366923aa96a7dc1d Applies changes to plans after [CALCITE-5073](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-5073) (**JoinConditionPushRule cannot infer 'LHS.C1 = LHS.C2' from 'LHS.C1 = RHS.C1 AND LHS.C2 = RHS.C1'**)
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/610b2916b0fe9dadf903d68cb573ba198fbadb9b Applies changes to plans after [CALCITE-4913](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-4913) (**Correlated variables in a select list are not deduplicated**)
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/14a3f6f12f6d235742b838377471ff472a30ea47 ~Applies changes to plans after [CALCITE-5134](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-5134) (**Queries with subquery inside select list does not work if subquery uses table from left join**)~ Applies changes to plans after [CALCITE-5169](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-5169) (**'xx < 1 OR xx > 1' cannot be simplified to 'xx <> 1'**)
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/a9e276a01fc515ea3a4d7de32a601e5016ec316f Applies changes to plans after [CALCITE-5021](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-5021) (**Double JOIN is created for NOT IN when IN-list that the values all non-nullable is converted to Values**)

UPD: 
https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/22558/commits/03c8b01fb991681a48c4ba40cb7d2f393121f742 Set new Calcite's property `AddJsonTypeOperator` to false and as a result revert changes for `DagoptimizationTest`


## Verifying this change

This change is already covered by existing tests.

title: [FLINK-32024][docs] Short code related to externalized connector retrieve version from its own data yaml
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

*Currently, we have some shortcodes specifically designed for externalized connector, such as `connectors_artifact`, `sql_connector_download_table`, etc.*

*When using them, we need to pass in a version number, such as `sql_connector_download_table "pulsar" 3.0.0`. It's easy for us to forget to modify the corresponding version in the document when releasing a new version.*

*Of course, we can hard code these into the release process. But perhaps we can introduce a version field to `docs/data/connector_name.yml` and let flink directly reads the corresponding version when rendering shortcode.*


## Brief change log

  - *Let short codes related to externalized connector retrieve version from its own data yaml.*


## Verifying this change

Test manually in my local env.

title: [FLINK-30585][flamegraph] Collect the flame graph of a single subtask instead of all subtasks when viewing the flame graph of a single subtask
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

After [FLINK-30185](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-30185) , we can view the flame graph of subtask level. However, it always collects flame graphs for all subtasks.

We should collect the flame graph of single subtask instead of all subtasks.

## Brief change log

[FLINK-30585][flamegraph] Collect the flame graph of a single subtask instead of all subtasks when viewing the flame graph of a single subtask

### Flame graph collection 

- The stats collected for job vertex and execution vertex will be collected into the executionVertexStatsCache.
- The stats collected for job vertex will be collected into the jobVertexStatsCache.

### Flame graph query

- The stats of job vertex will query from the executionVertexStatsCache.
- The stats of execution vertex will query from the executionVertexStatsCache.

## Verifying this change


This change added tests and can be verified as follows:

  - *Improved all old tests inside of the `VertexThreadInfoTrackerTest`*
  - *Added the `VertexThreadInfoTrackerTest#testExecutionVertexCachedStatsUpdatedAfterRefreshInterval `*

title: [FLINK-31919][core] Only run closure cleaner if serialization fails
body:
Avoid unnecessary reflective accesses by the closure cleaner by only running it on objects/fields for which serialization fails.

In the ideal world this means it is only applied to user lambdas/anonymous classes, never touching any JDK stuff.

body:
## What is the purpose of the change

After test execution, during cluster shutdown there is a chance that Yarn AMRM gets an interruption during its heartbeat logic, which generates an exception and when that happens, tests will fail because that exact exception is not whitelisted at the moment.

## Brief change log

Added a new exception to the `YarnTestBase` whitelist.

title: [FLINK-30081][runtime] Reset unused options like jvm-overhead.min/max for local executor
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-30081

In local executor, it's not possible to set different values for `taskmanager.memory.jvm-overhead.max` and `taskmanager.memory.jvm-overhead.min`. When setting them differently, local executor reports `Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException` error.

The problem was that we expect the max and min to equal, but they are not resolved to the same value for local executor. Actually the two values are not effective for local, we should reset them to the same value.

## Brief change log

- reset the two JVM overhead config to the same value for local executor
- fix a bug in l


## Verifying this change

This change is already covered by existing tests, such as `TaskExecutorResourceUtilsTest`. It also adds a new test case in this class.
